ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I became a better singer in every way!
I continued to learn how to sing pretty!
I further progressed in the path of becoming a true musician, and learning how to be less fragmented so that I can have a cohesive performance.
I continued my studies in voice.
A lot of new skills and motivation to continue being a musician.

I have gotten so much out of my lessons this year. First, I think that my technique has improved dramatically: I feel so much more relaxed and comfortable when I play, and I feel like I also have a better handle on more technical skills like a range of vibratos and bow technique. Most importantly, my love for the violin has only grown this year, and I am so excited to keep up with so much music in the years to come!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: No complaints, all praise. Prof. Wei-Yi is so insightful, and I can only hope that I can keep up with the pace. I'm forever grateful for the chance to study under him.
Communications about auditions and juries need to be sent out earlier.
I really love working 1 on 1 with a grad student, and he was able to tailor his teaching to my needs.

I really don't have any suggestions for how to make lessons better. They were always something I looked forward to every week! Lessons with Wendy are so enjoyable because I feel challenged but also intensely cared about. I am so fortunate to be her student!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, take lessons with Janna if you can.
If you want to learn how to sing pretty, then yes; you will learn how to sing pretty.
If you are serious about your instruments this course is a great way to keep improving while earning academic credit.
Yes! Very helpful lessons at no price.
Yes, if you want to continue taking music lessons on a middle to high commitment level, take lessons for credit.

Yes, I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. It is so clear that Wendy cares intensely about what she teaches and who she is teaching. She expects her students to give a hearty effort in return, but this never feels too much to ask because she gives so much to them.
